title: Eurovision winner to stand for Brexit Party
text:
Placards are seen on the seats before Leader of the Brexit Party, Nigel Farage speaks onstage on August 27, 2019 in London, England | Leon Neal/Getty images Eurovision winner to stand for Brexit Party Bucks Fizz singer chosen as parliamentary candidate for Nigel Farage’s party.

A former member of the band Bucks Fizz — winners of the Eurovision Song Contest in 1981 — is standing to be a member of parliament for Nigel Farage's Brexit Party.

In the event of a general U.K. election, Jay Aston Colquhounis hopes to become an MP in the London seat of Kensington, currently held by Labour. She was a member of Bucks Fizz from 1981 to 1985.

"I want to stand for the Brexit Party and fight to uphold democracy for the sake of the people," she said, according to the BBC. "As an MP, I will work to rebuild trust and help the Brexit Party make the necessary reforms to unite the country after we break free of the European Union."

The band's Eurovision-winning song was "Making your mind up" and they also had a big hit with the in-no-way-connected-to-Brexit "Land of make believe."
description: Bucks Fizz singer chosen as parliamentary candidate for Nigel Farage’s party.
